item.title: WBDのMax（旧HBO Max）では、脚本家や監督などのクリエイターの具体的なクレジットは表示されず、「クリエイター」の下にまとめられている（Lesley Goldberg/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Lesley Goldberg / The Hollywood Reporter:
WBD's Max, formerly HBO Max, does not provide specific credits for writers, directors, and other creatives, instead grouping them under “Creators”  —  The former HBO Max no longer provides specific credits for writers, directors and other creatives.

item.title: The American Prospect、Balls and Strikes、Bolts、The Guardian US、Hammer & Hope、Popular Information、States Newsroomはどのように政治ジャーナリズムを変えているか（Perry Bacon Jr/Washington Post)
item.description:
Perry Bacon Jr / Washington Post:
How The American Prospect, Balls and Strikes, Bolts, The Guardian US, Hammer & Hope, Popular Information, and States Newsroom are changing political journalism  —  Political journalism is in crisis.  Over the past few months, BuzzFeed News, FiveThirtyEight, Vice and a number of other outlets …

item.title: ジェラルディン・R・ドッジ財団からの200万ドルが地元ジャーナリズムに与えた広大な影響と、地元の人々が実験する余地を持つことで成長したシビックインパクトとは（Molly de Aguiar氏）。
item.description:
Molly de Aguiar:
How $2M from the Geraldine R. Dodge Foundation had a sprawling impact on local journalism, and how civic impact grew when local people had room to experiment  —  Trusting local people, championing their dreams, and giving them the resources to build a different future.  —  By Molly de Aguiar + Josh Stearns

item.title: 2019年に〜50万人だった購読者を2022年12月に30のメール製品で100万人を突破させるニューヨークマガジンのニュースレターへの投資を見てみる（Mark Stenberg/Adweek）
item.description:
Mark Stenberg / Adweek:
A look at New York Magazine's investment in newsletters, growing its subscribers from ~500K in 2019 to pass 1M across its 30 email products in December 2022  —  The publisher has used pop-up, subscriber-only newsletters to boost retention  —  Since retooling its newsletter strategy in 2019 …

item.title: イーロン・マスクがTwitterを買収した意図は、従来のメディアツールを解体するだけでなく、Twitterを右翼メディアの重鎮にすることだったようだ（Philip Bump/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Philip Bump / Washington Post:
Elon Musk's intent in buying Twitter apparently was not only to dismantle a traditional media tool but also to turn Twitter into a right-wing media heavyweight  —  It was only a year ago that Elon Musk, then simply the guy who was hoping to buy Twitter, insisted that his politics sat squarely at the center of the national spectrum.

item.title: ニューヨーク・タイムズがNewsGuild of New Yorkと給与の最低額を65Kドルに設定する暫定合意に達し、来週中に投票が行われる予定（Katie Robertson/New York Times）。
item.description:
Katie Robertson / New York Times:
The New York Times reaches a tentative deal with the NewsGuild of New York that would set a salary minimum of $65K; a vote is expected in the coming week  —  The new agreement, if ratified, will give union members immediate salary increases of up to 12.5 percent.

item.title: 脚本家のストライキの中、劇作家がWGAと妥協点を見つけ、6月11日のトニー賞が脚本なしで進行できるように努力した方法（Michael Paulson/New York Times)
item.description:
Michael Paulson / New York Times:
How playwrights worked to find a compromise with the WGA amid the writers' strike to allow the Tony Awards on June 11 to go on, without a written script  —  The screenwriters' strike threatened next month's broadcast, a key marketing moment for the fragile theater industry.

item.title: 米西海岸の編集者がThe Messengerの発売前に辞めた。彼女は、長編ジャーナリズムのために雇われたが、仕事は集約されたコンテンツとクリックベイトを要求されたと語った（Corbin Bolies/The Daily Beast）。
item.description:
Corbin Bolies / The Daily Beast:
A US West Coast editor quit before The Messenger launched; she said she was hired for long-form journalism but the job demanded aggregated content and clickbait  —  “What was presented to me as the job and what the job was was two entirely different things,” said Bender, an editor who quit the much-hyped startup days before its launch.

item.title: ジョージタウン大学とナイト財団、研究者、ジャーナリスト、テックリーダーを政策でつなぐ「ナイト・ジョージタウン研究所」の設立に3,000万ドルを拠出(ジョージタウン大学)
item.description:
Georgetown University:
Georgetown and the Knight Foundation commit $30M to establish the Knight-Georgetown Institute to connect researchers, journalists, and tech leaders on policy  —  Georgetown has partnered with the John S. and James L. Knight Foundation to invest $30 million in a nonpartisan institute …

item.title: ニュース共有アプリArtifactは、ユーザーが記事をクリックベイトとしてフラグを立てることができるようになり、報告された記事を監視して配信を減らしたり見出しを変えたりする可能性がある（Jay Peters/The Verge）。
item.description:
Jay Peters / The Verge:
News sharing app Artifact now lets users flag articles as clickbait, monitoring reported articles to potentially reduce distribution or change their headlines  —  Feel like an article is clickbait-y?  Artifact, the AI-powered news app from Instagram's co-founders, now has a tool that lets you feel like you can do something about it.

item.title: BBCは、ポッドキャスティングの人気を利用しようと、デザートアイランドディスクやその他のラジオ4の番組を、公共サービス部門からBBCスタジオに移すことを計画している（Jim Waterson/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Jim Waterson / The Guardian:
The BBC plans to move Desert Island Discs and other Radio 4 shows to BBC Studios, from its public service unit, to try to capitalize on podcasting's popularity  —  BBC Studios to look for overseas commercial opportunities for long-running radio show - and others, and focus on podcasts

item.title: Spotifyは、Spotify傘下のポッドキャストネットワーク「The Ringer」の創設者であるBill Simmonsによると、ホストの声を学習させたAIツールを構築し、ターゲット広告を作成している（Will Gendron/Insider）。
item.description:
Will Gendron / Insider:
Spotify is building AI tools trained on its hosts' voices to create targeted ads, per Bill Simmons, the founder of the Spotify-owned podcast network The Ringer  —  - Bill Simmons, founder of The Ringer, hinted at Spotify's future AI plans.  — He said that the streaming service is working on technology for AI-generated ads.

item.title: 英国のニュースメディア協会が、地方紙が発行する多数の公告を集約するオンラインサービス「公告ポータル」を開始（Bron Maher/Press Gazette)
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
The UK's News Media Association launches the Public Notice Portal, an online service that aggregates the numerous public notices published by local newspapers  —  The News Media Association has launched its Public Notice Portal, an online platform that brings together the numerous public announcements published by local newspapers.

item.title: Mirror Group Newspapersの電話ハッキング裁判で、Alastair CampbellはDaily Mirrorの編集者Piers Morganが自分の銀行口座をハッキングするよう記者に命じたと信じていると述べた（Jim Waterson/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Jim Waterson / The Guardian:
In Mirror Group Newspapers' phone hacking trial, Alastair Campbell says he believes Daily Mirror editor Piers Morgan ordered reporters to hack his bank account  —  Former editor allegedly told reporter to obtain details of Campbell's mortgage payments in 1999

item.title: Netflix、米国でパスワード共有を取り締まり、一部のアカウントで月額7.99ドルで世帯外のメンバーを追加できる有料共有を提供（Todd Spangler/Variety）。
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Netflix cracks down on password sharing in the US and offers paid sharing, which lets some accounts add an extra member outside their household for $7.99/month  —  Streamer intros “extra member” option priced at $7.99/month for adding access to those outside account holder's household
